intro: Guettarda preneloupii, commonly known as the pink guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant, pinkish-white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a velvety texture. Guettarda preneloupii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in tropical gardens due to its attractive foliage and continuous flowering.
